l4/util/assert.h

00001 /*****************************************************************************/
00009 /*
00010  * (c) 2009 Author(s)
00011  *     economic rights: Technische Universit√§t Dresden (Germany)
00012  * This file is part of TUD:OS and distributed under the terms of the
00013  * GNU Lesser General Public License 2.1.
00014  * Please see the COPYING-LGPL-2.1 file for details.
00015  */
00016 
00017 /*****************************************************************************/
00018 #pragma once
00019 
00020 #ifndef DEBUG
00021 
00022 #define DO_NOTHING              do {} while (0)
00023 #define ASSERT_VALID(c)         DO_NOTHING
00024 #define ASSERT_EQUAL(a,b)       DO_NOTHING
00025 #define ASSERT_NOT_EQUAL(a,b)   DO_NOTHING
00026 #define ASSERT_LOWER_EQ(a,b)    DO_NOTHING
00027 #define ASSERT_GREATER_EQ(a,b)  DO_NOTHING
00028 #define ASSERT_BETWEEN(a,b,c)   DO_NOTHING
00029 #define ASSERT_IPC_OK(i)        DO_NOTHING
00030 #define ASSERT_OK(e)            DO_NOTHING
00031 #define ASSERT_NOT_NULL(p)      DO_NOTHING
00032 #ifndef assert
00033 #define assert(cond)            DO_NOTHING
00034 #endif
00035 
00036 #else // DEBUG 
00037 
00038 #include <stdio.h>
00039 #include <assert.h>
00040 #include <l4/sys/kdebug.h>
00041 
00042 #define ASSERT_VALID(cap) \
00043   do { \
00044     if (l4_is_invalid_cap(cap)) { \
00045       printf("%s: Cap invalid.\n", __func__); \
00046       assert(l4_is_invalid_cap(cap)); \
00047     } \
00048   } while (0)
00049 
00050 
00051 #define ASSERT_EQUAL(a, b) \
00052   do { \
00053     if ((a) != (b)) { \
00054       printf("%s:\n", __func__); \
00055       printf("    "#a" (%lx) != "#b" (%lx)\n", (unsigned long)(a), (unsigned long)(b)); \
00056       assert((a)==(b)); \
00057     } \
00058   } while (0)
00059 
00060 
00061 #define ASSERT_NOT_EQUAL(a, b) \
00062   do { \
00063     if ((a) == (b)) { \
00064       printf("%s:\n", __func__); \
00065       printf("    "#a" (%lx) == "#b" (%lx)\n", (unsigned long)(a), (unsigned long)(b)); \
00066       assert((a)!=(b)); \
00067     } \
00068   } while (0)
00069 
00070 
00071 #define ASSERT_LOWER_EQ(val, max) \
00072   do { \
00073     if ((val) > (max)) { \
00074       printf("%s:\n", __func__); \
00075       printf("    "#val" (%lx) > "#max" (%lx)\n", (unsigned long)(val), (unsigned long)(max)); \
00076       assert((val)<=(max)); \
00077     } \
00078   } while (0)
00079 
00080 
00081 #define ASSERT_GREATER_EQ(val, min) \
00082   do { \
00083     if ((val) < (min)) { \
00084       printf("%s:\n", __func__); \
00085       printf("    "#val" (%lx) < "#min" (%lx)\n", (unsigned long)(val), (unsigned long)(min)); \
00086       assert((val)>=(min)); \
00087     } \
00088   } while (0)
00089 
00090 
00091 #define ASSERT_BETWEEN(val, min, max) \
00092   ASSERT_LOWER_EQ((val), (max)); \
00093     ASSERT_GREATER_EQ((val), (min));
00094 
00095 
00096 #define ASSERT_IPC_OK(msgtag) \
00097   do { \
00098     if (l4_ipc_error((msgtag), l4_utcb())) { \
00099       printf("%s: IPC Error: %lx\n", __func__, l4_ipc_error(msgtag)); \
00100       assert(!l4_ipc_error(msgtag)); \
00101     } \
00102   } while (0)
00103 
00104 #define ASSERT_OK(val)         ASSERT_EQUAL((val), 0)
00105 #define ASSERT_NOT_NULL(ptr)   ASSERT_NOT_EQUAL((ptr), NULL)
00106 
00107 #endif // DEBUG
L4Re - L4 Runtime Environment
